wikipedia_page.main: Terry Gerald Eades (5 March 1944 — 4 October 2021) was a Northern Irish former professional  footballer who played in Football League for Cambridge United and Watford.

response: In March 1969, Leggett signed for Southern League rivals Cambridge United, following manager Bill Leivers' recruitment of ex-Chelmsford teammates Terry Butcher, Bill Cassidy and Terry Eades. In Leggett's first full season at Cambridge, the club won the 1969–70 Southern League, winning election to the Football League in the process. On 29 August 1970, Leggett recorded a goal and an assist in a 3–1 home win against Oldham Athletic in Cambridge's first Football League victory. Leggett made 69 appearances for Cambridge, scoring seven times, retiring in 1971 due to injuries.
**Terry Eades, Northern Irish footballer (Cambridge United, Watford) and manager (Histon), cancer (b. 1944).
*Terry Eades, 77, Northern Irish football player (Cambridge United, Watford) and manager (Histon), cancer.Terry Eades (1944–2021)
* 4 October 2021: Terry Eades, 77, Cambridge United defender.
